description.narrative: Strengthened political commitment, accountability and capacity at the national / sub-national level to develop and adopt equitable and gender-sensitive policies, budgeted plans in select under served States for scaling up of WASH interventions to promote safe drinking water, adequate sanitation and good hygiene practices.

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 617/618 Diplomatic Drive Central Business District PMB 2851 Garki Abuja

sector.narrative: Building evaluation capacity in UNICEF and the UN system
Management and Operations support at CO
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened political commitment, accountability and capacity at the national / sub-national level to develop and adopt equitable and gender-sensitive policies, budgeted plans in select under served States for scaling up of WASH interventions to promote safe drinking water, adequate sanitation and good hygiene practices.

description.narrative: In 2017, UNICEF contributed to the development of State WASH policies in additional 3 States (Adamawa, Edo and Zamfara) and the establishment of WASH Departments across all the LGAs in Kano and Kaduna States. UNICEF also influenced the development of plans/strategies & leveraged 6.75 million USD as government contribution. | Status:Met | As-of Date:16/01/2018

title.narrative: National monitoring systems reporting on equity of access to WASH services available
National strategy for eliminating Open Defecation is available
Existence of functioning sector coordination mechanism for water, sanitation and hygiene
